intro: Eriocaulon pinarense, commonly known as the pinareño sedge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil and Venezuela. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its slender, grass-like stems are often covered with fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Eriocaulon pinarense produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the Cyperaceae family.
